page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY - BUILDINGS
page.content: {ALL SAINTS'CHURCH HARMSTON:}Built of local stone in mediaeval style but tower only of C11 with Decorated parapet and 8 pinnacles. Church has clerestorial nave of 3 bays. Exterior restored in 1868. The font is Norman bowl. 8-bell ring hung in 1789-90. {HARMSTON HALL:}Large C17 stone house and stables built for Thorold family. {ALL SAINTS CHURCH COLEBY:}Norman stonework with Saxon tower. Interior 2-bayed arcade with late Norman chancel arch and Perpendicular N.aisle windows.Circular stone font is Norman. {COLEBY HALL: }East front 1628 with C18 and C19 additions and restorations. Gateway is copy of Roman Newport Arch. {TEMPLES} "Romulus & Remus" by Chambers (1762) and a further dedicated to William Pitt the Elder. {COLEBY WELLHEADS:}In village 2 unusual domed stone caps known as "lock ups".
